content: little creek buff a cosy buff to keep you warm when winter hits about this pattern a quick easy buff/cowl that is narrow and sits close to the neck for maximum warmth it s not bulky and is perfect for wearing under hoodies coats or jackets i ve used a simple but fun drop-stitch motif that is repeated in the round to create a reversible fabric ©jacqui verbeek 2020 page �1 skills needed abbreviations used in you need to be able to cast on bind off pattern knit purl and knit in the round co cast on sizing there is one adult size but this can be k knit stitch customised by increasing/decreasing co stitches by 8 and increasing/ p purl stitch decreasing the length of the buff yo yarn over my buff measures 11 in length and wrap your has a circumference of 19 after working yarn blocking over the right hand needle to gauge create a new 20 stitches over 40 row in ribbing = 4 stitch important i am a very tight knitter ds drop the so if you just knit this without stitch off your checking gauge you are likely to get a left needle and larger finished object than me and pull on fabric require more yarn my advice is to knit gently to a quick gauge swatch to ensure the correct fit create a ladder that stops at yarn the yarn over 8ply/dk or 4ply/fingering weight yarn held double created in i used great southern yarn dk 50% merino/ 50% alpaca in the rosalie previous row gascoigne colour bobble bind off i used approx 70g of wool for this needles 4mm 16 circulars i used the small 4 length needles so that i could knit in the round comfortably as mentioned above i am a tight knitter so you may need to use a smaller sized needle to achieve the same fit/gauge support and feedback i ve tried very hard to ensure this pattern is error-free but i welcome any feedback if something doesn t look right or doesn t make sense you can contact me with any feedback or questions on email knittedbyjacquiverbeek@gmail com please note that i am located in australia so there might be a delay in responding due to the time difference ©jacqui verbeek 2020 page �2 pattern co 88 stitches with your preferred co method i used the long tail cast on as it gives a nice stretch ensuring
